required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Comparison of Anterior Knee Pain in Patella With or Without Denervation in Medial Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: The Comparison of Anterior Knee Pain in Patella With or Without Denervation in Medial Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: the present study will conduct to assess anterior knee pain and complications after medial UKA with or without patella denervation in medial compartment arthritis and severe lateral facet patellofemoral arthritis patients.

detailed_description.textblock: In this prospective cohort study, the investigators will conduct to compare the clinical result of 70 patients of unicompartment knee arthroplasty with and without patella denervation between April, 2018 and April, 2019 for the patients with osteoarthritis.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: unicompartment knee arthroplasty with patella denervation
study_design_info.masking_description: unicompartment knee arthroplasty without patella denervation

primary_outcome.description: Kujala score including 13 parameters with the score of 0-100, the higher the score the better the function.

secondary_outcome.description: number of participant with DVT, infections, loosening of implants, fractures, lateral compartment arthritis, and dislocations of the polyethylene

arm_group.arm_group_label: unicompartment knee arthroplasty and patella denervation
unicompartment knee arthroplasty and patella non-denervation

intervention.arm_group_label: unicompartment knee arthroplasty and patella denervation
unicompartment knee arthroplasty and patella non-denervation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who diagnose with medial osteoarthritis (OA) of the knee with an Alhback score of 2, 3 and 4 (Ahlback 1968) and with any Kujala score for pre-operative anterior knee pain.
- Older than 40 years of age.
- pain on the medial joint line.
- primary medial compartment osteoarthritis with a well preserved lateral compartment with competent cruciate ligaments with correctable intraarticular varus deformity.
- ROM flexion up to 110° under anesthesia.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with fixed varus deformity > 15°
- Inflammatory arthritis
- Previous high tibial osteotomy or ACL reconstruction
